BENTONITE

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_padding=”0px||0px|||” collapsed=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,2_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ width=”90%” max_width=”95%” module_alignment=”center” custom_padding=”101px||7px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ border_width_right=”1px” border_color_right=”#ffffff” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.gmciltd.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Bentonite.jpg” title_text=”Bentonite” align_tablet=”center” align_phone=”center” align_last_edited=”on|tablet” _builder_version=”4.4.7″ custom_padding=”||0px|||” animation_style=”slide” animation_direction=”left” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ global_colors_info=”{}” filter_hue_rotate__hover_enabled=”off|desktop” filter_hue_rotate__hover=”31deg”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.4.7″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#004B4F” text_font_size=”19px” text_letter_spacing=”0.5px” text_line_height=”1.6em” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”20px||||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|67|67|100|4|0|-4″ text_text_color_tablet=”” text_text_color_phone=”” text_text_color_last_edited=”on|phone” text_font_size_tablet=”19px” text_font_size_phone=”17px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” text_orientation_tablet=”center” text_orientation_phone=”center” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Bentonite is a plastic clay, mainly made of montmorillonite, generated by an alteration in situ of volcanic ash. Bentonite has significant colloidal properties and decreases its thickness many times as it falls into contact with liquids, forming a gelatinous and viscous material.The unique properties of swelling, water absorption, viscosity and thixotropy make it very useful for a wide variety of products.

Bentonite is a silicate hydrated aluminium with special water and swell absorption potential. It has multiple markets and structural engineering applications.

Our standardized processes and our optimistic culture of living up to our reputation as a reliable manufacturer ensures that our goods meet the highest standards.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”my-bullets” _builder_version=”4.4.7″ text_font=”Lato|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#004b4f” text_font_size=”18px” text_letter_spacing=”0.5px” text_line_height=”1.6em” header_font=”|||on|||||” header_6_font=”Lato|700||on|||||” header_6_text_color=”#004b4f” header_6_font_size=”25px” header_6_line_height=”1.5em” custom_padding=”0px||||false|false” custom_padding_tablet=”|||20px|false|false” custom_padding_phone=”20px|||20px|false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|tablet” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|67|67|100|4|0|-4″ text_text_color_tablet=”” text_text_color_phone=”” text_text_color_last_edited=”on|phone” text_font_size_tablet=”19px” text_font_size_phone=”17px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” header_6_font_size_tablet=”24px” header_6_font_size_phone=”24px” header_6_font_size_last_edited=”on|desktop” text_orientation_tablet=”left” text_orientation_phone=”left” text_orientation_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Key Features
  • Strong colloidal properties
  • Swelling when in contact with water
  • Water absorption
  • High viscosity
  • High plasticity
  • Thixotropy

excerpt.rendered: ProductsBENTONITEBentonite is a plastic clay, mainly made of montmorillonite, generated by an alteration in situ of volcanic ash. Bentonite has significant colloidal properties and decreases its thickness many times as it falls into contact with liquids, forming a gelatinous and viscous material.The unique properties of swelling, water absorption, viscosity and thixotropy make it very useful […]
